contentList.content: The ancestors of dragonborn hatched from the eggs of chromatic and metallic dragons. One story holds that these eggs were blessed by the dragon gods Bahamut and Tiamat, who wanted to populate the multiverse with people created in their image. Another story claims that dragons created the first dragonborn without the gods' blessings. Whatever their origin, dragonborn have made homes for themselves on the Material Plane. Dragonborn look like wingless, bipedal dragons - scaly, bright-eyed, and thick-boned with horns on their heads - and their coloration and other features are reminiscent of their draconic ancestors.

Tieflings are either born in the Lower Planes or have fiendish ancestors who originated there . is linked by blood to a devil, a demon, or some other Fiend. This connection to the Lower Planes is the tiefling's fiendish legacy, which comes with the promise of power yet has no effect on the tiefling's moral outlook. A tiefling chooses whether to embrace or lament their fiendish legacy.

Halflings possess a brave and adventurous spirit that leads them on journeys of discovery, affording them the chance to explore a bigger world and make new friends along the way. Their size - similar to that of a human child - helps them pass through crowds unnoticed and slip through tight spaces. Anyone who has spent time around halflings has likely witnessed the storied "luck of the halflings" in action. Many halflings believe in the power of luck, and they attribute their unusual gift to one or more of their benevolent gods, including Yondalla, Brandobaris, and Charmalaine.

Found throughout the multiverse, humans are as varied as they are numerous, and they endeavor to achieve as much as they can in the years they are given. Their ambition and resourcefulness are commended, respected, and feared on many worlds. Scholars dispute the origin of humanity, but one of the earliest known human gatherings is said to have occurred in Sigil, the torus-shaped city at the center of the multiverse and the place where the Common language was born. From there, humans could have spread to every part of the multiverse, bringing the City of Doors' cosmopolitanism with them.

Orcs trace their creation to Gruumsh who equipped his children with gifts to help them wander great plains, vast caverns, and churning seas and to face the monsters that lurk there. Orcs are, on average, tall and broad. They have gray skin, ears that are sharply pointed, and prominent lower canines that resemble small tusks.

Gnomes are magical folk created by gods of invention, illusions, and life underground. The earliest gnomes were seldom seen by other folk due to the gnomes' secretive nature and their propensity for living in forests and burrows. What they lacked in size, they made up for in cleverness. They confounded predators with traps and labyrinthine tunnels. They also learned magic from gods like Garl Glittergold, Baervan Wildwanderer, and Baravar Cloakshadow, who visited them in disguise. Gnomes are petite folk with big eyes and pointed ears, who live around 425 years.

Towering over most folk, goliaths are distant descendants of giants. Each goliath bears the favors of the first giants - favors that manifest in various supernatural boons, including the ability to quickly grow and temporarily approach the height of goliaths' gigantic kin. Goliaths have physical characteristics that are reminiscent of the giants in their family lines. For example, some goliaths look like stone giants, while others resemble fire giants. Whatever giants they count as kin, goliaths have forged their own path in the multiverse - unencumbered by the internecine conflicts that have ravaged giantkind for ages - and seek heights above those reached by their ancestors.
Bound by a pact to an all-powerful patron, warlocks trade their loyalty for supernatural abilities and unique magic.
You gain a <LSTag Tooltip="WarlockSpellSlot">Warlock Spell Slot</LSTag>.
Most of your Warlock spells have become stronger.
In your study of occult lore, you have unearthed eldritch invocations, fragments of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with an abiding magical prowess.

Replenish half of your expended <LSTag Tooltip="WarlockSpellSlot">Warlock Spell Slots</LSTag> (rounded up) while out of combat. If you are an <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="CL_Passive_OneDnD_EldritchMaster">Eldritch Master</LSTag>, replenish all of your <LSTag Tooltip="WarlockSpellSlot">Warlock Spell Slots</LSTag> instead.
You gain spells from your Patron. They are <LSTag Tooltip="AlwaysPrepared">Always Prepared</LSTag>.
Graced by a lady or lord of the fey, you are imbued with all the sumptuous and scary qualities of your patron's extraordinary realm.
Warlocks serving fiends work towards corrupt, destructive ends and receive hellish blessings in turn.
Warlocks bound to eldritch beings in the Far Realm work towards inscrutable goals, gaining strange powers over entropy and the mind.
Your specialisation in an arcane spell school lets you learn additional magic from your chosen discipline. Choose an additional spell to add to your Spellbook.
Your specialisation in an arcane spell school lets you learn additional magic from your chosen discipline. Choose an additional spell to add to your Spellbook.
Your specialisation in an arcane spell school lets you learn additional magic from your chosen discipline. Choose an additional spell to add to your Spellbook.
Your specialisation in an arcane spell school lets you learn additional magic from your chosen discipline. Choose an additional spell to add to your Spellbook.
Your specialisation in an arcane spell school lets you learn additional magic from your chosen discipline. Choose an additional spell to add to your Spellbook.
Your specialisation in an arcane spell school lets you learn additional magic from your chosen discipline. Choose an additional spell to add to your Spellbook.
Your specialisation in an arcane spell school lets you learn additional magic from your chosen discipline. Choose an additional spell to add to your Spellbook.
Your specialisation in an arcane spell school lets you learn additional magic from your chosen discipline. Choose an additional spell to add to your Spellbook.
You have become a true thespian. Your gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Deception and Performance <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>.
You gain a bonus to your Initiative equalt to your Proficiency Bonus and can't be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SURPRISED">Surprised</LSTag>.
When you deal Bludeoning damage to a creature that is Large or smaller, you can also push it up to [1].

When you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">critical hit</LSTag> that deals Bludeoning damage to a creature, <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> made against this creature have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> until the start of your next turn.

You can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="LuckPoint">Luck Point</LSTag> to gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, or to make an enemy reroll their Attack Roll.
You have gained <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> with Martial Weapons.
You know how to play musical instruments and can perform a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DnD5R_SongOfRest_Musician">Song of Rest</LSTag>.
Unarmed attacks deal [1], unless their normal damage is higher.
Once per turn when you deal unarmed damage to a creature, you can also push it up to [1].

Attacks with <LSTag Tooltip="MonkWeapon">Monk Weapons</LSTag> and unarmed attacks deal [1], unless their normal damage is higher and scale with your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> instead of your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> if your Dexterity is higher. In addition, you can make <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="CL_Target_OneDnD_MartialArts_UnarmedStrikeBonus">Unarmed Strikes</LSTag> as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>.

Replenish half of your expended <LSTag Tooltip="WarlockSpellSlot">Warlock Spell Slots</LSTag> (rounded up) while out of combat. If you are an <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Passive_DnD5R_EldritchMaster">Eldritch Master</LSTag>, replenish all of your <LSTag Tooltip="WarlockSpellSlot">Warlock Spell Slots</LSTag> instead.
When you use your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DnD5R_MagicalCunning">Magical Cunning feature</LSTag>, you replenish all of your <LSTag Tooltip="WarlockSpellSlot">Warlock Spell Slots</LSTag>.
You gain spells from your Patron. They are <LSTag Tooltip="AlwaysPrepared">Always Prepared</LSTag>.
Can make an additional free attack after making an attack with your Pact Weapon. If you gain the Extra Attack feature from more than one class, they don't add together.
You learn how to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DnD5R_OneWithShadows">One with Shadows</LSTag>.
You learn how to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DnD5R_OtherworldlyLeap">Otherworldy Leap</LSTag>.
While studying magic, you also specialised in an academic field of study. You have Expertise in the chosen skill.

Launch a mote of light at a target. Until the end of your next turn, the target emits dim light a [1] radius and cannot benefit from the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> condition.
Shedding dim light a [1] radius and cannot benefit from the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> condition.
<LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> made against this creature have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.

Replenish half of your expended <LSTag Tooltip="WarlockSpellSlot">Warlock Spell Slots</LSTag> (rounded up) while out of combat. If you are an <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Passive_DnD5R_EldritchMaster">Eldritch Master</LSTag>, replenish all of your <LSTag Tooltip="WarlockSpellSlot">Warlock Spell Slots</LSTag> instead.

Vanish into the darkness and become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag>. Attacks against you have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> and you attack with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
Spew forth a column of acid.
Spew forth a cone of acid.
Spew forth a cone of acid. (75)
Spew forth a cone of acid. (90)
Spew forth a column of acid. (1m)
Unarmed attacks damage rolls of a 1 are rerolled.
When an enemy makes an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, it receives a -[1] penalty.
Whenever a creature makes an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against you before the spell ends, it receives a -[1] penalty.
Whenever a creature makes an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against you before the spell ends, it receives a -[1] penalty.
While you aren’t wearing any armor, your base Armor Class equals 10 plus your Dexterity and Constitution modifiers. You can use a Shield and still gain this benefit.
You have resistance agaist acid damage
You have resistance agaist cold damage
You have resistance agaist fire damage
You have resistance agaist lightning damage
You have resistance agaist poison damage
Project a puff of noxious gas.
Hurl the conjured flame in your hand at a target and let it sizzle out.
Throwing the flame this turn doesn't cost an action. Throwing it on subsequent turns will cost an action.
Reduces the target's <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by [1].
Throw a bubble of acid that damages each creature it hits.

You create an acidic bubble at a point within range, where it explodes in a 5-foot-radius Sphere. Each creature in that Sphere must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 Acid damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d6 when you reach levels 5 (2d6), 11 (3d6), and 17 (4d6).

You hurl a beam of crackling energy. Make a ranged spell attack against one creature or object in range. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Force damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The spell creates two beams at level 5, three beams at level 11, and four beams at level 17. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or an object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell starts burning if it isn’t being worn or carried.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d10 when you reach levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10).
You spray toxic mist at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d12 Poison damage.
Hurl a sphere that deals [1] and possibly creates a surface on impact. Alternatively, choose a different type of damage.
Hurl caustic energy that damages the target and creates an <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ACID">Acid</LSTag> surface on impact.
Hurl freezing energy that damages the target and creates a frosty surface to knock creatures <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Hurl fiery energy that damages the target and creates a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BURNING">Burning</LSTag> surface on impact.
Hurl lightning energy that damages the target and creates an electrified surface on impact.
Hurl poisonous energy that damages the target and creates a bubbling surface to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poison</LSTag> creatures.
Hurl a sphere of thunderous energy.
The next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against this target has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
The thorns deal [1] to the target and then explode. The explosion deals an additional [2] to the target and surrounding creatures.
Link yourself to a target with a bolt of lightning. Deal an additional [1] each turn by activating it.
Shoot [2] magical darts, each dealing [1]. They always hit their target.
Throw a shard of ice that deals [1]. It explodes and deals [2] to anyone nearby. It leaves an ice surface.
This spell can be cast while you are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silenced</LSTag>.
Make a ranged attack with your equipped weapon.
Your attack summons thorny vines that possibly <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENSNARING_STRIKE">Ensnare</LSTag> your target.
Possibly marks your target with light, preventing it from turning <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag>.
Shoot a green arrow that covers the target and the ground with acid. Deals [1] immediately and [2] at the end of the target's turn.
Weaken a foe: they deal half damage with weapon attacks using <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>.
Hurl [2] rays of fire. Each ray deals [1].
Shoot a bright flame from your fingers that explodes upon contact, torching everything in the vicinity.
